TXT_KEY_TECH_SMART_MATERIALS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"What we are interested in is merging the computer with the clothing so that all you need to do is get dressed."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Neil Gershenfeld
TXT_KEY_TECH_PARTICLE_BEAMS_DESC Particle Beams ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_PARTICLE_BEAMS_CIV A particle beam weapon uses an ultra-high-energy beam of atoms or electrons (i.e. a particle beam) to damage a material target by hitting it, and thus disrupting its atomic and molecular structure. A particle beam weapon is a type of directed-energy weapon, which directs energy in a particular direction by a means of particle projectiles with mass. Some of these weapons are real or practical; some are science fiction.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PARTICLE_BEAMS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fusion Tank[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heavy Isotope Projector[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Beam Jumper[ENDCOLOR], and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Beam Foundry[ENDCOLOR] which is required for construction of many Nano Age particle beam wielding military units.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PARTICLE_BEAMS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"But while it will make every nation safe against any attack by a would-be invader, the death-beam by its nature could not be employed similarly as a weapon for offense. For this death-beam, could be generated only from large, stationary and immovable power plants, stationed in the manner of old-time forts at various strategic distances from each country's border. An exception however, must be made in the case of battleships, which would be able to equip themselves with smaller plants for generating the death-beam, with enough power to destroy any airplane approaching for attack from the air."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Nikola Tesla (inventor of the first particle beam weapon)
TXT_KEY_TECH_MIND_MELDING_DESC Mind Melding ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MIND_MELDING_CIV Mind Melding takes advances in mind manipulation and allows 2 or more humans to temporarily combine their thoughts as one. Not only does this allow high speed passing of technical information, but for the first time true emotions can be shared between individuals, with great, far reaching, and ultimately unforseeable consequences.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MIND_MELDING_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Empathic Network[ENDCOLOR] which increases the [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, [ICON_RESEARCH] Science, AND [ICON_GOLD] Gold of all specialists in your empire.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MIND_MELDING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The miracle is this: the more we share the more we have."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Leonard Nimoy
TXT_KEY_TECH_SENTIENT_ROBOTS_DESC Sentient Robots ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SENTIENT_ROBOTS_CIV Sentient robots represents the final realization, or perhaps general reluctant acceptance, by humans that sentient machines are real, and they are here to stay. While this does not guarantee robots any rights or priveledges, it does bring them a step up from being officially regarded as mere tools.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SENTIENT_ROBOTS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Robot District[ENDCOLOR] and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Robotic Egalitarian Act[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_TECH_SENTIENT_ROBOTS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"But hath not a robot eyes? Hath not a robot hands, organs, dimensions, senses, affections, passions? If you prick us, do we not bleed?"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Johnny Five
TXT_KEY_TECH_UNDERWATER_HABITATION_DESC Underwater Habitation ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_UNDERWATER_HABITATION_CIV Underwater Habitation is the culmination of years of overcrowding, combined with the technology and materials to do something about it. Humans can now begin to seriously colonize the other 75% of the earth that is currently uninhabited mankind, to the benefit or detriment of the planet, depending on your viewpoint.
TXT_KEY_TECH_UNDERWATER_HABITATION_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ocean Habitat Prototype[ENDCOLOR] which greatly increases nearby sea tile yields and sets the stage for future underwater cities.
TXT_KEY_TECH_UNDERWATER_HABITATION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The extreme conditions of a long underwater mission are similar to those of space. Someday, these techniques could be used in long-duration, manned space flights."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - David Williams
TXT_KEY_TECH_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_DESC Wormhole Detection ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_CIV Wormhole Detection is the latest scientific pursuit of the unknown. Advances in Field Theories and their practical applications have allowed scientists to detect ripples and changes in the fabric of spacetime, leading to the possibility of proving the existence of wormholes once and for all. Scientists have no clear consensus on what finding such a wormhole might mean for science or humanity, but they are not wasting any time in finding out.
TXT_KEY_TECH_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Wormhole Detection Array[ENDCOLOR] which completes the science victory for it's creator.
TXT_KEY_TECH_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The Air Force is to be applauded for investigating technologies that may have value for national security, ... But wormholes, negative energies, warped space-time, etc., require futuristic technologies centuries to millions of years ahead of ours. The only thing going down the wormhole is taxpayers' money."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Michio Kaku
TXT_KEY_TECH_WARP_FIELD_THEORY_DESC Warp Field Theory ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_WARP_FIELD_THEORY_CIV Warp Field Theory encompasses the manipulation of spacetime in ways feasible by and beneficial to mankind.
TXT_KEY_TECH_WARP_FIELD_THEORY_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Particle Grid Air Defense[ENDCOLOR] and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Space Manipulation Testing Station[ENDCOLOR] which greatly increases great scientist generation.
TXT_KEY_TECH_WARP_FIELD_THEORY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Since the mathematicians have invaded the theory of relativity, I do not understand it myself anymore."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Albert Einstein
TXT_KEY_TECH_ULTRA_PRESSURE_MACHINERY_DESC Ultra Pressure Machinery ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ULTRA_PRESSURE_MACHINERY_CIV Ultra Pressure Machinery allows the use of highly precise, advanced machinery in extremely pressurized environments found both at the bottom of the ocean, and within the ultra high pressure environments found in fusion reactors.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ULTRA_PRESSURE_MACHINERY_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Plasma Destroyer[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fusion Dreadnought[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Supercavitating Submarine[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Submersible Carrier[ENDCOLOR], and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Vacuum Drydock[ENDCOLOR] which is required for construction of many Nano Age sea units.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ULTRA_PRESSURE_MACHINERY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The machine does not isolate us from the great problems of nature but plunges us more deeply into them."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Antoine de Saint-Exupery
TXT_KEY_TECH_EXTREME_ENGINEERING_CIV Extreme Engineering represents the height of human engineering. Using the latest processes, materials, and tools, projects of unheard of magnitude can be undertaken and accomplished.
TXT_KEY_TECH_EXTREME_ENGINEERING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Scientists investigate that which already is; Engineers create that which has never been."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Albert Einstein
TXT_KEY_TECH_ARCOLOGIES_DESC Arcologies ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ARCOLOGIES_CIV Arcology, a combination of the words "architecture" and "ecology", is a set of architectural design principles aimed toward the design of enormous habitats (hyperstructures) of extremely high human population density. These largely hypothetical structures would contain a variety of residential, commercial, and agricultural facilities and minimize individual human environmental impact. They are often portrayed as self-contained or economically self-sufficient.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ARCOLOGIES_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Shimzu Mega City Pyramid[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Arcology[ENDCOLOR] Building, which greatly increases [ICON_GOLD] Gold generation.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ARCOLOGIES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We cannot afford to permit squalid overcrowding or the kind of living system which makes impossible the decencies and necessities of life."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Teddy Rossevelt
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBLIMINAL_MIND_CONTROL_DESC Subliminal Mind Control ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBLIMINAL_MIND_CONTROL_CIV BioComputer Interfaces allow human, and even animal, users to directly access and control information technology using only their bodies and even thoughts.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBLIMINAL_MIND_CONTROL_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mind Control Network[ENDCOLOR] which greatly increases [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness at the expense of economic production.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBLIMINAL_MIND_CONTROL_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"All wrong-doing arises because of mind. If mind is transformed can wrong-doing remain?"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Buddha
TXT_KEY_TECH_CYBERNETIC_ORGANISMS_DESC Cybernetic Organisms ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_CYBERNETIC_ORGANISMS_CIV Cyborg(CYBernetic ORGanism) A being that is part human and part machine. The term was coined in 1960 by Manfred Clynes and Nathan Kline in an article they wrote about how humans can survive in space. For centuries, various cultures have fantasized about half human-half artificial beings; however, in the 20th century this concept materialized in the form of artificial limbs, pacemakers and other bionic devices.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CYBERNETIC_ORGANISMS_HELP Allows training of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Leap Infantry[ENDCOLOR] and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cybernetic Marauder[ENDCOLOR] which are two cheap Nano Age mainstay units.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CYBERNETIC_ORGANISMS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I'm a cybernetic organism: living tissue over a metal endoskeleton."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - The Terminator
TXT_KEY_TECH_NEURAL_REPROGRAMMING_DESC Neural Reprogramming ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_NEURAL_REPROGRAMMING_CIV Neural Reprogramming is a highly controversial technology that allows the reprogramming of human minds. Primarily focused and championed as a cure for violent criminals and incurable psychiatric patients, this technology could potentially be applied to the average citizen.
TXT_KEY_TECH_NEURAL_REPROGRAMMING_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Behavioral Mod Chip[ENDCOLOR] which increases economic activity by lowering crime and mental illness.
TXT_KEY_TECH_NEURAL_REPROGRAMMING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"It is a man's own mind, not his enemy or foe, that lures him to evil ways."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Buddha
TXT_KEY_TECH_MECHANICAL_BODY_GRAFTING_CIV Mechanical Body Grafting represents a breakthrough in the ability to physically fuse human flesh with mechanical implements. In the past, such mechanical aids were attached using age old methods involving simply strapping them to the body, with minimal support or control ability. Now, mechanical body parts can be fused to the body in such a way that they are practically an extension therof. The body powers it, and the mind controls it, seemlessly.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MECHANICAL_BODY_GRAFTING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Gentlemen, we can rebuild him, we have the technology, we have the capability to build the world's first bionic man. Steve Austin will be that man. We can make him better than he was before; better, stronger, faster."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Oscar Goldman
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_SYNTHESIS_DESC Biological Synthesis ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_SYNTHESIS_CIV Biological Synthesis represents a breakthrough in the ability to create tailored biological material from scratch, with or without a base template. While primarily focused on the matching of biological materials to prohibit rejection, labs and factories can now create large quantities of precisely designed food for human or animal consumption. Another benefit of this research is the ability to begin research into the creation of new and unique life forms.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_SYNTHESIS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Beef Vat[ENDCOLOR] which can supply a near endless source of food.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_SYNTHESIS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The synthesis of pure, calming food is breathing pure air, listening to good sounds, looking at good sights, and touching pure objects."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Sri Sathya Sai Baba
TXT_KEY_TECH_AI_SURVEILLANCE_DESC AI Surveillance ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_AI_SURVEILLANCE_CIV AI Surveillance combines advances in Artificial Intelligence with the ever growing information and security industries. Using AI to monitor video and other information feeds, security in a complex can be precisely as broad and as omniscient as it's network of cameras and sensors allow it to be.
TXT_KEY_TECH_AI_SURVEILLANCE_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]AI Security Center[ENDCOLOR] which increases economic activity across the board by reducing crime, as well as acidents.
TXT_KEY_TECH_AI_SURVEILLANCE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"It can also be argued that DNA is nothing more than a program designed to preserve itself. Life has become more complex in the overwhelming sea of information. And life, when organized into species, relies upon genes to be its memory system. So man is an individual only because of his own undefinable memory. But memory cannot be defined, yet it defines mankind. The advent of computers and the subsequent accumulation of incalculable data has given rise to a new system of memory and thought, parallel to your own. Humanity has underestimated the consequences of computerization."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Puppet Master
TXT_KEY_TECH_VIRTUAL_REALITY_DESC Virtual Reality ([ICON_RESEARCH]/[ICON_CULTURE])
TXT_KEY_TECH_VIRTUAL_REALITY_CIV Virtual Reality is the ultimate computer generated reality simulation which can encompass any number of real or fictional environments for the purposes of entertainment, research, or any number of other possible fields that are only now being opened up to humanity. It is possible that humankind may one day live out it's entire existence in an augmented reality, or virtual landscape.
TXT_KEY_TECH_VIRTUAL_REALITY_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]VR Interface[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Virtual Securities Exchange[ENDCOLOR] Buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_VIRTUAL_REALITY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If some unemployed punk in New Jersey, can get a cassette to make love to Elle McPherson for $19.95, this virtual reality stuff is going to make crack look like Sanka."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Dennis Miller
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_NANITES_DESC Biological Nanites ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_NANITES_CIV Nanorobotics is the technology of creating machines or robots at or close to the microscopic scale of a nanometer (10−9 meters). More specifically, nanorobotics refers to the still largely hypothetical nanotechnology engineering discipline of designing and building nanorobots, devices ranging in size from 0.1-10 micrometers and constructed of nanoscale or molecular components. As of 2010 nobody has yet built artificial non-biological nanorobots: they remain a hypothetical concept. The names nanobots, nanoids, nanites or nanomites have also been used to describe these hypothetical devices.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_NANITES_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Immunity Chip[ENDCOLOR] which increases food kept and happiness.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIOLOGICAL_NANITES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"This means the ability to put small numbers of atom and molecules where we want them, to form materials, structures and devices that benefit from such a high level of control and precision."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Andrew Maynard
TXT_KEY_TECH_FREE_SPACE_SATURATION_DESC Free Space Saturation ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FREE_SPACE_SATURATION_CIV Free Space Saturation uses particle beam technology combined with warp field theory to saturate large volumes of space, thereby denying enemy access due to large scale atmosphereic disturbances, in addition to the direct particle field effects on hypersonic aircraft and projectiles.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FREE_SPACE_SATURATION_HELP Allows construction of the stalwart [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Particle Grid Air Defense[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FREE_SPACE_SATURATION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If our air forces are never used, they have achieved their finest goal."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - General Nathan F. Twining
TXT_KEY_PROJECT_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_ARRAY Wormhole Detection Array
TXT_KEY_PROJECT_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_ARRAY_HELP When the Wormhole Detection Array is completed, you win a [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Science Victory[ENDCOLOR]!
TXT_KEY_PROJECT_WORMHOLE_DETECTION_ARRAY_PEDIA The Wormhole Detection Array is a feat of human engineering that places many detection stations around the solar system, all of which coordinate to pinpoint possible wormhole entrances. Any such wormhole entrances could potentially open up the stars to human colonization, or perhaps even alien contact.
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERDING_TITLE Herding ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERDING_DESC Markets for trading various livestock.
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERDING_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cattle Ranch[ENDCOLOR],[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT] Sheep Ranch[ENDCOLOR], and[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT] Deer Herder[ENDCOLOR], the first buildings in their respective Monopoly trees.
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERDING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"In order to be an immaculate member of a flock of sheep, one must above all be a sheep oneself."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Albert Einstein
TXT_KEY_TECH_RAW_MATERIALS_TITLE Raw Materials ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_RAW_MATERIALS_DESC Markets for trading various raw materials.
TXT_KEY_TECH_RAW_MATERIALS_HELP Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Stone[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jade[ENDCOLOR] one the map.[NEWLINE]Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Knossos Palace[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ivory Artist[ENDCOLOR] Building.
TXT_KEY_TECH_RAW_MATERIALS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A rolling stone gathers no moss, but it gains a certain polish."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Oliver Herford
TXT_KEY_TECH_GREAT_MONUMENTS_TITLE Great Monuments ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_GREAT_MONUMENTS_DESC Various Wonders dedicated to notable figures.
TXT_KEY_TECH_GREAT_MONUMENTS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mausoleum of Halicarnassus[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]The Labyrnth[ENDCOLOR], and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sphinx[ENDCOLOR] Wonders.
TXT_KEY_TECH_GREAT_MONUMENTS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TXT_KEY_TECH_ORAL_TRADITION_TITLE Oral Tradition ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ORAL_TRADITION_DESC Oral tradition and oral lore is cultural material and tradition transmitted orally from one generation to another.[1][2] The messages or testimony are verbally transmitted in speech or song and may take the form, for example, of folktales, sayings, ballads, songs, or chants. In this way, it is possible for a society to transmit oral history, oral literature, oral law and other knowledges across generations without a writing system.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ORAL_TRADITION_HELP Allows construction of the useful [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Shaman's Hut[ENDCOLOR] building.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ORAL_TRADITION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The life of my people is to remember forever; each head granary is full. The life of your people is to forget: your thing granaries ("museums"), and not yourselves, are full."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Alice Walker
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRAINING_TITLE Military Training ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRAINING_DESC Military education and training is a process which intends to establish and improve the capabilities of military personnel in their respective roles. Military education can be voluntary or compulsory duty. Before any person gets authorization to operate technical equipment or be on the battle field, they must take a medical and often a physical test. If passed, they may begin primary training.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRAINING_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Barracks[ENDCOLOR] , [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Working Camp[ENDCOLOR] ,[COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Dungeon[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Palace Guard Room[ENDCOLOR] Buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRAINING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The aim of military training is not just to prepare men for battle, but to make them long for it."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Louis Simpson
TXT_KEY_TECH_WOODWORKING_TITLE Wood Working ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_WOODWORKING_DESC Along with stone, mud and animal parts, wood was one of the first materials worked by early humans. Historically, woodworkers relied upon the woods native to their region, until transportation and trade innovations made more exotic woods available to the craftsman. Woods are typically sorted into three basic types: hardwoods typified by tight grain and derived from broadleaf trees, softwoods from coniferous trees, and man-made materials such as plywood and MDF.
TXT_KEY_TECH_WOODWORKING_HELP Reveals [ICON_RES_OAK] Oak and [ICON_EXOTICHARDWOOD] Exotic Hardwood on the map.[NEWLINE]It allows the construction of the powerful [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Composite Bowman[ENDCOLOR] Unit and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Lumberjack[ENDCOLOR] Building.[NEWLINE]Add yields +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production to every [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forest[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jungle[ENDCOLOR] .
TXT_KEY_TECH_WOODWORKING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"From such crooked wood as that which man is made of, nothing straight can be fashioned."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Immanuel Kant
TXT_KEY_TECH_PUBLIC_WORKS_TITLE Public Works ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_PUBLIC_WORKS_DESC Public works are a broad category of projects, financed and constructed by the government, for recreational, employment, and health and safety uses in the greater community. They include bridges, parks, roads, municipal buildings, dams, railroads, schools, hospitals, beaches, and other, usually long-term, physical assets and facilities. Though often interchangeable with public infrastructure and public capital, public works does not necessarily carry an economic component, thereby being a broader term.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PUBLIC_WORKS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Terracotta Army[ENDCOLOR] Wonder, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Public Baths[ENDCOLOR], and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Deep Iron Mine[ENDCOLOR] Buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PUBLIC_WORKS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The fondest wish of my heart ever was that the surplus portion of these taxes, destined for the payment of that debt, should be applied, in time of peace, to the improvements of our country by canals, roads, and useful institutions."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Thomas Jefferson
TXT_KEY_TECH_FISH_MARKETS_TITLE Fish Markets ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_FOOD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FISH_MARKETS_DESC A fish market is a marketplace used for marketing fish products. It can be dedicated to wholesale trade between fishermen and fish merchants, or to the sale of seafood to individual consumers, or to both. Retail fish markets, a type of wet market, often sell street food as well.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Because seafood is quick to spoil, fish markets are historically most often found in seaside towns. Once ice or other simple cooling methods became available, some were also established in large inland cities that had good trade routes to the coast.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since refrigeration and rapid transport became available in the 19th and 20th century, fish markets can technically be established at any place. However, because modern trade logistics in general has shifted away from marketplaces and towards retail outlets, such as supermarkets, most seafood worldwide is now sold to consumers through these venues, like most other foodstuffs.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Consequently, most major fish markets now mainly deal with wholesale trade, and the existing major fish retail markets continue to operate as much for traditional reasons as for commercial ones. Both types of fish markets are often tourist attractions as well.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FISH_MARKETS_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fisher[ENDCOLOR]Building.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FISH_MARKETS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Fish and visitors smell in three days."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Benjamin Franklin
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERBAL_SCIENCE_TITLE Herbal Science ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERBAL_SCIENCE_DESC Field of science dedicated to finding natural cures.
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERBAL_SCIENCE_HELP Reveals Aloe Vera, Amber, and Poppy, which are used in the construction of Monopoly buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_HERBAL_SCIENCE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I think it's wrong the way they criminalize herb. There are many more uses than just smoking. Beneficial to mankind."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ziggy Marley
TXT_KEY_TECH_STONE_MASONS_TITLE Stone Masons ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_STONE_MASONS_DESC Group of people dedicated to finding, using, and profiting from geological resources.
TXT_KEY_TECH_STONE_MASONS_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE]Copper Depot[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE]Stone Depot[ENDCOLOR], and[COLOR_POSITIVE] Jade Market[ENDCOLOR] Monopoly buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_STONE_MASONS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"In every block of marble I see a statue as plain as though it stood before me, shaped and perfect in attitude and action. I have only to hew away the rough walls that imprison the lovely apparition to reveal it to the other eyes as mine see it."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Michelangelo
TXT_KEY_TECH_LIVESTOCK_DISTRIBUTION_TITLE Livestock Distribution ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_HEALTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_LIVESTOCK_DISTRIBUTION_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Horse Breeder[ENDCOLOR]Building.[NEWLINE]Increase [ICON_HEALTH] Health by +1.
TXT_KEY_TECH_LIVESTOCK_DISTRIBUTION_DESC Livestock are domesticated animals raised in an agricultural setting to produce commodities such as food, fiber and labor. This article does not discuss poultry or farmed fish, although these, especially poultry, are commonly included within the meaning of "livestock". Livestock generally are raised for profit. Raising animals (animal husbandry) is a component of modern agriculture. It has been practiced in many cultures since the transition to farming from hunter-gather lifestyles.
TXT_KEY_TECH_LIVESTOCK_DISTRIBUTION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I go about looking at horses and cattle. They eat grass, make love, work when they have to, bear their young. I am sick with envy of them."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Sherwood Anderson
TXT_KEY_TECH_OCEAN_PIONEERING_TITLE Ocean Pioneering ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_OCEAN_PIONEERING_DESC Throughout history, scientists have relied on a number of instruments to measure, map, and observe the ocean's depths. One of the first instruments used to examine the seafloor was the sounding weight. Ancient Viking sailors took measurements of sea depth and sampled seafloor sediments with this instrument, which consisted of a lead weight with a hollow bottom attached to a line. Once the weight reached the sea bottom and collected a sample of the seabed, the line was hauled back on board ship and measured in fathom.[11] Cornelius Drebbel, a Dutch architect, is generally given credit for construction of the first submarine. His submersible boat consisted of a wooden frame sheathed in animal skin. Oars, with its openings were sealed with tight-fitting leather flaps, extended out the sides to propel the craft through the water, at depths up to 4.6 meters (15 ft). Drebel tested his submarine in the Thames River in England in sometime between 1620 and 1624. It is believed that King James I may have enjoyed a short ride in the craft.
TXT_KEY_TECH_OCEAN_PIONEERING_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE]Kronborg[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE]Seaport[ENDCOLOR] Buildings.
TXT_KEY_TECH_OCEAN_PIONEERING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"In a word I was a pioneer, and therefore had to blaze my own trail."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Major Taylor
TXT_KEY_TECH_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE_DESC International trade is the exchange of capital, goods, and services across international borders or territories.[1] In most countries, such trade represents a significant share of gross domestic product (GDP). While international trade has been present throughout much of history (see Silk Road, Amber Road), its economic, social, and political importance has been on the rise in recent centuries.
TXT_KEY_TECH_INTERNATIONAL_TRADE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Few people think more than two or three times a year; I have made an international reputation for myself by thinking once or twice a week."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - George Bernard Shaw
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_SCIENCES_TITLE Agricultural Sciences ([ICON_FOOD]/[ICON_HEALTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_SCIENCES_DESC Agricultural science is a broad multidisciplinary field that encompasses the parts of exact, natural, economic and social sciences that are used in the practice and understanding of agriculture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]With the exception of theoretical agronomy, research in agronomy, more than in any other field, is strongly related to local areas. It can be considered a science of ecoregions, because it is closely linked to soil properties and climate, which are never exactly the same from one place to another. Many people think an agricultural production system relying on local weather, soil characteristics, and specific crops has to be studied locally. Others feel a need to know and understand production systems in as many areas as possible, and the human dimension of interaction with nature.
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_SCIENCES_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE]Titicaca Sea[ENDCOLOR] Wonder.[NEWLINE]Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE]Manganes[ENDCOLOR][ICON_MANGANESE],[COLOR_POSITIVE]Aloe Vera[ENDCOLOR][ICON_ALOEVERA] and [COLOR_POSITIVE]Poppy[ENDCOLOR][ICON_POPPY] on the map.[NEWLINE]Increase global [ICON_HEALTH] Health by +1.
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_SCIENCES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Agriculture not only gives riches to a nation, but the only riches she can call her own."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Samuel Johnson
TXT_KEY_TECH_ECONOMY_OF_SCALE_TITLE Economy of Scale ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_FOOD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ECONOMY_OF_SCALE_DESC Economies of scale, in microeconomics, refers to the cost advantages that a business obtains due to expansion. There are factors that cause a producer’s average cost per unit to fall as the scale of output is increased. "Economies of scale" is a long run concept and refer to reductions in unit cost as the size of a facility and the usage levels of other inputs increase.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ECONOMY_OF_SCALE_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Village Garden[ENDCOLOR] Building.[NEWLINE]Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Coconut[ENDCOLOR] , [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Barley[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Olives[ENDCOLOR] on the map.[NEWLINE]Your Worker [ICON_WORKER] can now build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Plantation[ENDCOLOR] improvement.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ECONOMY_OF_SCALE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Good wives and good plantations are made by good husbands."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Benjamin Franklin
TXT_KEY_TECH_FERMENTATION_TITLE Fermentation ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FERMENTATION_DESC Fermentation in food processing typically is the conversion of carbohydrates to alcohols and carbon dioxide or organic acids using yeasts, bacteria, or a combination thereof, under anaerobic conditions. A more restricted definition of fermentation is the chemical conversion of sugars into ethanol. The science of fermentation is known as zymurgy.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Fermentation usually implies that the action of microorganisms is desirable, and the process is used to produce alcoholic beverages such as wine, beer, and cider. Fermentation is also employed in the leavening of bread, and for preservation techniques to create lactic acid in sour foods such as sauerkraut, dry sausages, kimchi and yogurt, or vinegar (acetic acid) for use in pickling foods.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FERMENTATION_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Orgie[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Brewery[ENDCOLOR] Buildings.[NEWLINE]Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Orgie[ENDCOLOR] Beer.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FERMENTATION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I fear the man who drinks water and so remembers this morning what the rest of us said last night."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Greek Proverb
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADING_TITLE Trading ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_TRADE]/[ICON_CRIME])
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADING_DESC Trade is the transfer of ownership of goods and services from one person to another. Trade is sometimes loosely called commerce or financial transaction or barter. A network that allows trade is called a market. The original form of trade was barter, the direct exchange of goods and services. Later one side of the barter were the metals, precious metals (poles, coins), bill, paper money. Modern traders instead generally negotiate through a medium of exchange, such as money. As a result, buying can be separated from selling, or earning. The invention of money (and later credit, paper money and non-physical money) greatly simplified and promoted trade. Trade between two traders is called bilateral trade, while trade between more than two traders is called multilateral trade.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Trade exists for man due to specialization and division of labor, most people concentrate on a small aspect of production, trading for other products. Trade exists between regions because different regions have a comparative advantage in the production of some tradable commodity, or because different regions' size allows for the benefits of mass production. As such, trade at market prices between locations benefits both locations.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADING_HELP Allowes construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Great Market[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Market[ENDCOLOR] , [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trader[ENDCOLOR] Buildings[NEWLINE]You can now build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trading Post[ENDCOLOR] improvement.[NEWLINE]Provides one additional [ICON_TRADE] Trade Route.[NEWLINE]Increase [ICON_CRIME] Crime by +2.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The merchant has no country"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Thomas Jefferson
TXT_KEY_TECH_FARMERS_MARKETS_TITLE Farmer's Markets ([ICON_FOOD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FARMERS_MARKETS_DESC Farmers Markets consist of individual vendors, mostly farmers, that are setup outdoors or indoors to sell produce, meat products, fruits and sometimes prepared foods. Such markets were commonplace before the Industrial age but most were replaced in modernized cities with grocery stores and supermarkets that sell food that is usually produced, packaged, shipped from remote places.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FARMERS_MARKETS_HELP Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Maize[ENDCOLOR] one the map.[NEWLINE]Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Silo[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Spice House[ENDCOLOR] Building.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FARMERS_MARKETS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A farmer is always going to be rich next year."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Philemon
TXT_KEY_TECH_ANIMAL_MARKETS_TITLE Animal Markets ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ANIMAL_MARKETS_DESC An auction is a process of buying and selling goods or services by offering them up for bid, taking bids, and then selling the item to the highest bidder. In economic theory, an auction may refer to any mechanism or set of trading rules for exchange.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]It is generally accepted that auctions were recorded as early as 500 B.C. They were Babylonian wedding auctions, held annually, where women were sold for the purpose of marriage. These auctions were of the "descending type" where the offers for the beautiful maidens started high and went down until the bidder accepted the maiden. The "true value" in many cases, related to beauty and the less comely maidens sometimes had to pay a dowry to be accepted. Thus the price could actually be negative figure for the buyer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Auctions were also used extensively during the Roman Empire. The refinement of the auction process grew to be much more organized and defined. In today's language, the key players became the consignor (the person on whose behalf the property was sold), the organizer (regulator, financial backer), the promoter (advertiser, auctioneer), and the buyer (highest and final bidder). Auctions were held at the "Atrium" for the purpose of selling the "spoils of war" at public auction for the soldiers after a military victory. Business agents were said to have accompanied the warriors into battle in order to facilitate and promote expected sales. (The Latin word for auction is auctus, which means to increase).[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Romans also used the auction to liquidate personal property. Marcus Aurelius is said to have auctioned off prized heirlooms and furniture. It's claimed that that auction lasted over two months.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ANIMAL_MARKETS_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cattle Trader[ENDCOLOR], [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Sheep Trader[ENDCOLOR], and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Deer Market[ENDCOLOR] line of buildings which are progressively more profitable as you attain more and more resources.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ANIMAL_MARKETS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"In order to be an immaculate member of a flock of sheep, one must above all be a sheep oneself."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Albert Einstein
TXT_KEY_TECH_APOTHECARY_TITLE Apothecary ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_APOTHECARY_DESC Drug use and abuse is as old as mankind itself. Human beings have always had a desire to eat or drink substances that make them feel relaxed, stimulated, or euphoric. Humans have used APOTHECARY of one sort or another for thousands of years. Wine was used at least from the time of the early Egyptians; narcotics from 4000 B.C.; and medicinal use of marijuana has been dated to 2737 BC in China.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]As time went by, "home remedies" were discovered and used to alleviate aches, pains and other ailments. Most of these preparations were herbs, roots, mushrooms or fungi. They had to be eaten, drunk, rubbed on the skin, or inhaled to achieve the desired effect.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Pre-Columbian Mexicans used many substances, from tobacco to mind-expanding (hallucinogenic) plants, in their medicinal collections. The most fascinating of these substances are sacred mushrooms, used in religious ceremonies to induce altered states of mind, not just drunkenness.
TXT_KEY_TECH_APOTHECARY_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Poppy Refinery[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aloe Vera Distillery[ENDCOLOR] line of buildings which are progressively more profitable as you attain more and more resources.
TXT_KEY_TECH_APOTHECARY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I used to have a drug problem, now I make enough money."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - David Lee Roth
TXT_KEY_TECH_COFFEE_TRADE_TITLE Coffee Trade ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_COFFEE_TRADE_DESC Coffee is a brewed drink prepared from roasted seeds, called coffee beans, of the coffee plant. They are seeds of coffee cherries that grow on trees in over 70 countries, cultivated primarily in Latin America, Southeast Asia, and Africa. Green unroasted coffee is one of the most traded agricultural commodities in the world. Due to its caffeine content, coffee often has a stimulating effect on humans. Today, coffee is the third most popular drink in the world, behind water and tea.
TXT_KEY_TECH_COFFEE_TRADE_HELP Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Coffee[ENDCOLOR][ICON_COFFEE] on the map.[NEWLINE]Allowes the construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Alchemist[ENDCOLOR] Building.
TXT_KEY_TECH_COFFEE_TRADE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"No one can understand the truth until he drinks of coffee's frothy goodness."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Sheik Abd-al-Kadir
TXT_KEY_TECH_MYSTICISM_TITLE Mysticism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MYSTICISM_DESC Mysticism is the pursuit of communion with, identity with, or conscious awareness of an ultimate reality, divinity, spiritual truth, or God through direct experience, intuition, instinct or insight. Mysticism usually centers on a practice or practices intended to nurture those experiences or awareness. Mysticism may be dualistic, maintaining a distinction between the self and the divine, or may be nondualistic.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MYSTICISM_HELP Allows you to build [ICON_CULTURE] Culture enhancing Temples and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Mahabodhi Temple[ENDCOLOR] wonder which reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_4] empire wide.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MYSTICISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"My words are very easy to know, and very easy to practice; but there is no one in the world who is able to know and able to practice them."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Legge, 70
TXT_KEY_TECH_CEREMONIAL_BURIAL_TITLE Ceremonial Burial ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_CEREMONIAL_BURIAL_DESC Burial is the act of placing a person or object into the ground. This is accomplished by excavating a pit or trench, placing an object in it, and covering it over.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Intentional burial, particularly with grave goods, may be one of the earliest detectable forms of religious practice since, as Philip Lieberman suggests, it may signify a "concern for the dead that transcends daily life." Though disputed, evidence suggests that the Neanderthals were the first hominids to intentionally bury the dead, doing so in shallow graves along with stone tools and animal bones. Exemplary sites include Shanidar in Iraq, Kebara Cave in Israel and Krapina in Croatia. Some scholars, however argue that these bodies may have been disposed of for secular reasons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The earliest undisputed human burial dates back 130,000 years. Human skeletal remains stained with red ochre were discovered in the Skhul cave at Qafzeh, Israel. A variety of grave goods were present at the site, including the mandible of a wild boar in the arms of one of the skeletons.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Prehistoric cemeteries are referred to by the more neutral term grave field. They are one of the chief sources of information on prehistoric cultures, and numerous archaeological cultures are defined by their burial customs, such as the Urnfield culture of the European Bronze Age.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CEREMONIAL_BURIAL_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Burial Mound[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_TECH_CEREMONIAL_BURIAL_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Cry 'Havoc', and let slip the dogs of war, that this foul deed shall smell above the earth with carrion men, groaning for burial."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - William Shakespeare
TXT_KEY_TECH_SPORTS_TITLE Sports ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SPORTS_DESC A sport is an organized, competitive, entertaining, and skillful activity requiring commitment, strategy, and fair play, in which a winner can be defined by objective means. It is governed by a set of rules or customs. Activities such as card games and board games, are classified as "mind sports" and some are recognized as Olympic sports, requiring primarily mental skills and mental physical involvement. Non-competitive activities, for example as jogging or playing catch are usually classified as forms of recreation.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SPORTS_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Olympics[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SPORTS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - George Orwell
TXT_KEY_TECH_POLYTHEISM_TITLE Polytheism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_POLYTHEISM_DESC Polytheism is the belief of multiple deities also known as gods, usually assembled into a pantheon of gods and goddesses, along with their own mythologies and rituals.
TXT_KEY_TECH_POLYTHEISM_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Parthenon[ENDCOLOR], which provides a decent boost to [ICON_CULTURE] Culture empire wide.
TXT_KEY_TECH_POLYTHEISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A man in this world without learning is as a beast of the field."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Unknown
TXT_KEY_TECH_MEDITATION_TITLE Meditation ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MEDITATION_DESC Meditation is a holistic discipline during which time the practitioner trains his or her mind in order to realize some benefit. Meditation is generally a subjective, personal experience and most often done without any external involvement, except perhaps prayer beads to count prayers. Meditation often involves invoking and cultivating a feeling or internal state, such as compassion, or attending to some focal point, etc. The term can refer to the process of reaching this state, as well as to the state itself.

TXT_KEY_TECH_MEDITATION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Hindu Prince Gautama Siddharta, the founder of Buddhism, 563-483 B.C.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHIPBUILDING_TITLE Shipbuilding ([ICON_STRENGTH]/[ICON_FOOD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHIPBUILDING_DESC Shipbuilding is the construction of ships. It normally takes place in a specialized facility known as a shipyard. Shipbuilders, also called shipwrights, follow a specialized occupation that traces its roots to before recorded history. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Shipbuilding and ship repairs, both commercial and military, are referred to as the "naval engineer". The construction of boats is a similar activity called boat building.

TXT_KEY_TECH_SHIPBUILDING_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people together to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, but rather teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Antoine de Saint-Exupery
TXT_KEY_TECH_MONOTHEISM_TITLE Monotheism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MONOTHEISM_DESC Monotheism is the belief in theology that only one deity exists. The concept of "monotheism" tends to be dominated by the concept of God in the Abrahamic religions, such as Judaism, Christianity, Islam, etc., by the Platonic concept of God as put forward by Pseudo-Dionysius the Areopagite, as well as the Advaita, Dvaita and Vishishtadvaita philosophies of Hinduism, although the latter philosophies admit the existence of a plethora of divine beings including less-powerful deities such as devas. Sikhism on the other hand, is a monotheistic Indian religion, in contrast to many schools of Hinduism and the other Indian religions.

TXT_KEY_TECH_MONOTHEISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Wisdom is a fountain of life to him who has it."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Proverbs 16:22
TXT_KEY_TECH_PRIESTHOOD_TITLE Priesthood ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_PRIESTHOOD_DESC A priest or priestess is a person having the authority or power to administer religious rites; in particular, rites of sacrifice to, and propitiation of, a deity or deities. Their office or position is the priesthood, a term which may also apply to such persons collectively.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PRIESTHOOD_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Abbey[ENDCOLOR] which provides a broad range of bonuses to [ICON_RESEARCH]Science, [ICON_CULTURE]Culture, and [ICON_GOLD]Gold generation.
TXT_KEY_TECH_PRIESTHOOD_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If someone had told me I would be Pope one day, I would have studied harder"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Pope John Paul I
TXT_KEY_TECH_CODE_OF_LAWS_TITLE Code of Laws ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_CODE_OF_LAWS_DESC In law, codification is the process of collecting and restating the law of a jurisdiction in certain areas, usually by subject, forming a legal code, i.e. a codex (book) of law.

TXT_KEY_TECH_CODE_OF_LAWS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"If a man destroys the eye of another man, they shall destroy his eye."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Hammurabi
TXT_KEY_TECH_CARRIAGES_TITLE Carriages ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_CARRIAGES_DESC A carriage is a wheeled vehicle for people, usually horse-drawn.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CARRIAGES_HELP Allows you to build the quick and powerful [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Chariot Archer[ENDCOLOR] unit, as well as the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Jiayuguan Fort[ENDCOLOR] Wonder.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CARRIAGES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Because I could not stop for death, He kindly stopped for me; The carriage held but just ourselves and immortality."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Emily Dickinson
TXT_KEY_TECH_POETRY_TITLE Poetry ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_POETRY_DESC Poetry (from the Latin poeta, a poet) is a form of literary art in which language is used for its aesthetic and evocative qualities in addition to, or in lieu of, its apparent meaning. Poetry may be written independently, as discrete poems, or may occur in conjunction with other arts, as in poetic drama, hymns, lyrics, or prose poetry. It is published in dedicated magazines (the longest established being Poetry and Oxford Poetry), individual collections and wider anthologies.
TXT_KEY_TECH_POETRY_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Heroic Epic[ENDCOLOR] national wonders which give new units free Morale promotions.
TXT_KEY_TECH_POETRY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Poetry is the music of the soul, and, above all, of great and feeling souls."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Voltaire
TXT_KEY_TECH_LITERATURE_TITLE Literature ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_LITERATURE_DESC Literature is the art of written works. Literally translated, the word literature means "acquaintance with letters" (as in the "arts and letters"). The two most basic written literary categories include fiction and nonfiction.
TXT_KEY_TECH_LITERATURE_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Literary Epic[ENDCOLOR] national wonders which significantly increase culture in the cities they are built in.
TXT_KEY_TECH_LITERATURE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The decline of literature indicates the decline of a nation."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
TXT_KEY_TECH_RUDDER_TITLE Rudder ([ICON_STRENGTH]/[ICON_TRADE])
TXT_KEY_TECH_RUDDER_DESC A rudder is a device used to steer a ship, boat, submarine, hovercraft, aircraft, or other conveyance that moves through a medium (generally air or water). On an aircraft the rudder is used primarily to counter adverse yaw and p-factor and is not the primary control used to turn the airplane. A rudder operates by redirecting the fluid past the hull or fuselage, thus imparting a turning or yawing motion to the craft. In basic form, a rudder is a flat plane or sheet of material attached with hinges to the craft's stern, tail or after end. Often rudders are shaped so as to minimize hydrodynamic or aerodynamic drag. On simple watercraft, a tiller -- essentially, a stick or pole acting as a lever arm—may be attached to the top of the rudder to allow it to be turned by a helmsman. In larger vessels, cables, pushrods, or hydraulics may be used to link rudders to steering wheels. In typical aircraft, the rudder is operated by pedals via mechanical linkages or hydraulics.
TXT_KEY_TECH_RUDDER_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Stone Town[ENDCOLOR]Wonder.[NEWLINE]You can now build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cog[ENDCOLOR] Medieval naval unit.[NEWLINE]Provides one additional [ICON_TRADE] Trade Route.
TXT_KEY_TECH_RUDDER_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"He who loves practice without theory is like the sailor who boards ship without a rudder and compass and never knows where he may cast."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Leonardo Da Vinci
TXT_KEY_TECH_DIVISION_OF_LABOR_TITLE Division of Labor ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_DIVISION_OF_LABOR_DESC Division of labour is the specialization of cooperative labour in specific, circumscribed tasks and like roles. Historically an increasingly complex division of labor is closely associated with the growth of total output and trade, the rise of capitalism, and of the complexity of industrialization processes. Division of labor was also a method used by the sumerians to categorize different jobs, and divide them to skilled members of a society.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Since the time of Plato, Division of Labor has been in the minds of economists and philosophers alike. The division of labour makes trade necessary and is the source of economic interdependence. Division of labor is a process whereby the production process is broken down into a sequence of stages and workers are assigned to particular stages.
TXT_KEY_TECH_DIVISION_OF_LABOR_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Workshop[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_TECH_DIVISION_OF_LABOR_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Well then, how will our state supply these needs? It will need a farmer, a builder, and a weaver, and also, I think, a shoemaker and one or two others to provide for our bodily needs. So that the minimum state would consist of four or five men...."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Plato, The Republic
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADE_FAIRS_TITLE Trade Fairs ([ICON_GOLD]/[ICON_TRADE])
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADE_FAIRS_DESC Begun in the medieval era as a way for lords to lure wealthy merchants, today trade fairs (trade show, trade exhibition or expo) are exhibitions organized so that companies in a specific industry can showcase and demonstrate their latest products, service, study activities of rivals and examine recent market trends and opportunities. In contrast to consumer fairs, only some trade fairs are open to the public, while others can only be attended by company representatives (members of the trade, e.g. professionals) and members of the press, therefore trade shows are classified as either "Public" or "Trade Only". A few fairs are hybrids of the two; one example is the Frankfurt Book Fair, which is trade-only for its first three days and open to the general public on its final two days. They are held on a continuing basis in virtually all markets and normally attract companies from around the globe. For example, in the U.S. there are currently over 2500 trade shows held every year, and several online directories have been established to help organizers, attendees, and marketers identify appropriate events.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADE_FAIRS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Todai_Ji[ENDCOLOR] Wonder, [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Regional Fair[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Cattler Driver[ENDCOLOR] Building.[NEWLINE]Provides one additional [ICON_TRADE] Trade Route.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRADE_FAIRS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Don't waste time learning the "tricks of the trade. Instead, learn the trade."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Unknown
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_REVOLUTION_TITLE Agricultural Revolution ([ICON_FOOD]/[ICON_HEALTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_REVOLUTION_HELP Allowes the construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]El Tajin[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Town Estate[ENDCOLOR] Building.[NEWLINE]Reveals [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tea[ENDCOLOR][ICON_TEA] on the map.[NEWLINE]Increase global [ICON_HEALTH] Health by +1.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allowes you to open the [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policy Branch [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Agriculture[ENDCOLOR]
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_REVOLUTION_DESC The Agricultural Revolution represents a combination of several small, but key inventions that revolutionize Medieval Agriculture. The first is Crop Rotation. By moving to a crop rotation system, farmers are able to work more of their field by replenishing the soil at a faster rate. The second invention is the horseshoe which allows Horses to overtake Oxen as the animal of choice on the farm. Horse allowed farmers to increase their yields and the distance they could bring their food to market. The third invention is the heavy plow, which allows farmers to plow deeper furrows in rougher fields in shorter amounts of time. The final invention is the use of animal labor to turn mills required for the creation of flour and other processed grains. The culminations of these technologies leads to a revolution in agriculture.
TXT_KEY_TECH_AGRICULTURAL_REVOLUTION_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"We see nothing on the horizon that can overturn the growing imbalance between demand and supply. Nor is the growing demand just a passing phase: We are smack in the middle of one of the most dramatic population explosions this planet has seen since the agricultural revolution in the early days of civilization."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Martin Weiss
TXT_KEY_TECH_BUREAUCRACY_TITLE Bureaucracy ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BUREAUCRACY_DESC In the social sciences, a bureaucracy is a large organization characterized by hierarchy, fixed rules, impersonal relationships, rigid adherence to procedures, and a highly specialized division of labor. Bureaucracies began in the middle ages as towns formed and began to wrest control from the nobles. By gaining independence from the landowners, the towns were able to gain support directly from the kings which greatly increased the stability of the time. Since then, Bureaucracies have grow to immense sizes, practically replacing the kings they once allied with.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BUREAUCRACY_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Town Hall[ENDCOLOR] which increases tax revenue.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BUREAUCRACY_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Every revolution evaporates and leaves behind only the slime of a new bureaucracy."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Franz Kafka
TXT_KEY_TECH_FEUDALISM_TITLE Feudalism ([ICON_STRENGTH]/[ICON_CRIME])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FEUDALISM_DESC Feudalism is a political and military system between a feudal aristocrat (a lord or liege), and his vassals. In its most classic sense, feudalism refers to the Medieval European political system composed of a set of reciprocal legal and military obligations among the warrior nobility, revolving around the three key concepts of lords, vassals, and fiefs.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FEUDALISM_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Pikeman[ENDCOLOR] [ICON_SILVER_FIST] Unit, the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Kremlin[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and your [ICON_WORKER] Workers can now build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Chateau[ENDCOLOR] Improvement.[NEWLINE]Increase [ICON_CRIME] Crime by +2.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allowes you to open the [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policy Branch [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Feudalism[ENDCOLOR] .
TXT_KEY_TECH_FEUDALISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"In democracy it's your vote that counts; in feudalism it's your count that votes."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Mogens Jallberg
TXT_KEY_TECH_SIEGE_ENGINES_TITLE Siege Engines ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SIEGE_ENGINES_DESC A siege engine is a device that is designed to break or circumvent City walls and other fortifications in siege warfare. Some have been operated close to the fortifications, while others have been used to attack from a distance. From antiquity, siege engines were constructed largely of wood and tended to use mechanical advantage to fling stones and similar missiles. With the development of gunpowder and improved metallurgical techniques, siege engines became artillery. Collectively, siege engines or artillery together with the necessary troops and transport vehicles to conduct a siege are referred to as a siege-train.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SIEGE_ENGINES_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Trebuchet[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_TECH_SIEGE_ENGINES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"And I will camp against thee round about, and will lay siege against thee with a mount, and I will raise forts against thee."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Bible
TXT_KEY_TECH_FUNDAMENTALISM_TITLE Fundamentalism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_FUNDAMENTALISM_DESC Fundamentalism refers to a belief in a strict adherence to specific set of theological doctrines typically in reaction against what are perceived as modern heresies of secularism.[
TXT_KEY_TECH_FUNDAMENTALISM_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Taj Mahal[ENDCOLOR] which enters you into a Golden Age, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Grand Mosque[ENDCOLOR] which significantly increases the amount of [ICON_CONNECTED] Trade route gold that you collect.
TXT_KEY_TECH_FUNDAMENTALISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"To this point doth my knowledge go, I only know I nothing know."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - 10th Century Persian poet Abu Shakur Balkhi
TXT_KEY_TECH_ALGEBRA_TITLE Algebra ([ICON_RESEARCH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ALGEBRA_DESC Algebra is the branch of mathematics concerning the study of the rules of operations and relations, and the constructions and concepts arising from them, including terms, polynomials, equations and algebraic structures. Together with geometry, analysis, topology, combinatorics, and number theory, algebra is one of the main branches of pure mathematics.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ALGEBRA_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Al Jabr[ENDCOLOR] wonder which grants you a free Great Scientist.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ALGEBRA_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The most powerful single idea in mathematics is the notion of a variable."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - K. Dewdney
TXT_KEY_TECH_BONDS_TITLE Bonds ([ICON_GOLD])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BONDS_DESC In finance, a bond is a debt security, in which the authorized issuer owes the holders a debt and, depending on the terms of the bond, is obliged to pay interest (the coupon) and/or to repay the principal at a later date, termed maturity. A bond is a formal contract to repay borrowed money with interest at fixed intervals.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Thus a bond is like a loan: the issuer is the borrower (debtor), the holder is the lender (creditor), and the coupon is the interest. Bonds provide the borrower with external funds to finance long-term investments, or, in the case of government bonds, to finance current expenditure. Certificates of deposit (CDs) or commercial paper are considered to be money market instruments and not bonds. Bonds must be repaid at fixed intervals over a period of time.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Bonds and stocks are both securities, but the major difference between the two is that (capital) stockholders have an equity stake in the company (i.e., they are owners), whereas bondholders have a creditor stake in the company (i.e., they are lenders). Another difference is that bonds usually have a defined term, or maturity, after which the bond is redeemed, whereas stocks may be outstanding indefinitely. An exception is a consol bond, which is a perpetuity (i.e., bond with no maturity).
TXT_KEY_TECH_BONDS_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Bond Market[ENDCOLOR] natioanl wonder.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BONDS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Solvency is maintained by means of a national debt, on the principle, 'If you will not lend me the money, how can I pay you?'"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Ralph Waldo Emerson
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLAST_FURNACE_TITLE Blast Furnace ([ICON_PRODUCTION])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLAST_FURNACE_DESC A blast furnace is a type of metallurgical furnace used for smelting to produce industrial metals, generally iron. In a blast furnace, fuel and ore are continuously supplied through the top of the furnace, while air (sometimes with oxygen enrichment) is blown into the bottom of the chamber, so that the chemical reactions take place throughout the furnace as the material moves downward. The end products are usually molten metal and slag phases tapped from the bottom, and flue gases exiting from the top of the furnace.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLAST_FURNACE_HELP Allows you to build the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Foundry[ENDCOLOR] which grants a significant bonus to [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLAST_FURNACE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Even the hardest metal yields to sufficient heat"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Gandhi
TXT_KEY_TECH_ENLIGHTENMENT_TITLE Enlightenment ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_ENLIGHTENMENT_DESC The Age of Enlightenment (or simply the Enlightenment) is the era in Western philosophy, intellectual, scientific and cultural life, centered upon the 18th century, in which reason was advocated as the primary source for legitimacy and authority. It is also known as the Age of Reason. The enlightenment was a movement of science and reason.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Developing simultaneously in France, Great Britain, Germany, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Portugal and the American colonies, the movement culminated in the Atlantic Revolutions, especially the success of the American Revolution, which resulted in independence from the British Empire. The authors of the American Declaration of Independence, the United States Bill of Rights, the French Declaration of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen, and the Polish-Lithuanian Constitution of May 3, 1791, were motivated by Enlightenment principles.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ENLIGHTENMENT_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]National Academy[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Pricipia Mathematica[ENDCOLOR] National Wonders.[NEWLINE]Add yields +1 [ICON_TOURISM] to every [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Academy[ENDCOLOR] improvement.
TXT_KEY_TECH_ENLIGHTENMENT_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Before enlightenment; chop wood, carry water. After enlightenment; chop wood, carry water."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Zen Proverb
TXT_KEY_TECH_EVANGELISM_TITLE Evangelism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_EVANGELISM_DESC Evangelism refers to the practice of relaying information about a particular set of beliefs to others who do not hold those beliefs. The term is often used in reference to Christianity. Christians who specialise in evangelism are known as evangelists whether they are in their home communities or acting as missionaries in the field. Some Christian traditions consider evangelists to be in a leadership position; they may be found preaching to large meetings or in governance roles. Christian groups who actively encourage evangelism are sometimes known as evangelistic or evangelist.
TXT_KEY_TECH_EVANGELISM_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Missionary Church[ENDCOLOR].
TXT_KEY_TECH_EVANGELISM_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Do all the good you can, in all the ways you can, to all the souls you can, in every place you can, at all the times you can, with all the zeal you can, as long as ever you can."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - John Wesley
TXT_KEY_TECH_CONSTITUTION_1_TITLE Constitution ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_CONSTITUTION_1_DESC A constitution is a set of laws that a set of people have made and agreed upon for government—often as a written document—that enumerates and limits the powers and functions of a political entity. These rules together make up, i.e. constitute, what the entity is. In the case of countries and autonomous regions of federal countries the term refers specifically to a constitution defining the fundamental political principles, and establishing the structure, procedures, powers and duties, of a government.
TXT_KEY_TECH_CONSTITUTION_1_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Declaration of Independence[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder, also the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Constabulary[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Race Track[ENDCOLOR]Buildings.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allowes you to open the [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policy Branch [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Constitutional[ENDCOLOR] .
TXT_KEY_TECH_CONSTITUTION_1_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The Constitution is not an instrument for the government to restrain the people, it is an instrument for the people to restrain the government."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Patrick Henry
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRADITION_1_TITLE Military Tradition ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRADITION_1_DESC Military tradition is the specific set of practices associated with the military or soldiers in general. The concept may describe the styles of military uniform, drill, or even the music of a military unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRADITION_1_HELP Allowes construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Brandenburger Gate[ENDCOLOR] Wonder and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ministry of War[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allowes you to open the [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policy Branch [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Fascism[ENDCOLOR]
TXT_KEY_TECH_MILITARY_TRADITION_1_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The God of War hates those who hesitate."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Euripides
TXT_KEY_TECH_NATIONALISM_1_TITLE Nationalism ([ICON_CULTURE]/[ICON_HAPPINESS_1])
TXT_KEY_TECH_NATIONALISM_1_DESC Nationalism involves a strong identification of a group of individuals with a political entity defined in national terms, i.e. a nation. Often, it is the belief that an ethnic group has a right to statehood, or that citizenship in a state should be limited to one ethnic group, or that multinationality in a single state should necessarily comprise the right to express and exercise national identity even by minorities. It can also include the belief that the state is of primary importance, or the belief that one state is naturally superior to all other states. It is also used to describe a movement to establish or protect a homeland (usually an autonomous state) for an ethnic group. In some cases the identification of a national culture is combined with a negative view of other races or cultures.
TXT_KEY_TECH_NATIONALISM_1_HELP Allows construction of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ranch[ENDCOLOR] which lows tile [ICON_CULTURE] Culture cost, increases [ICON_FOOD] Food, and gives a slight [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness bonus while requiring [ICON_RES_HORSES] Horses, and the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Hermitage[ENDCOLOR] National Wonder and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Forbidden Palace[ENDCOLOR] Wonder.[NEWLINE]Add yields +1 [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age Points to every [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Landmark[ENDCOLOR].[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Allowes you to open the [ICON_CULTURE] Social Policy Branch [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Nationalism[ENDCOLOR]
TXT_KEY_TECH_NATIONALISM_1_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Patriotism is when love of your own people comes first; nationalism, when hate for people other than your own comes first."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Charles DeGaulle
TXT_KEY_TECH_NAVAL_ARMOR_TITLE Naval Armor ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_NAVAL_ARMOR_DESC The advent of naval armor brought forth an age of armored ships, beginning with the Ironclads. The first ironclad battleship, La Gloire, was launched by the French Navy in 1859; she prompted the British Royal Navy to start building ironclads. After the first clashes of ironclads took place during the American Civil War, it became clear that the ironclad had replaced the unarmoured line-of-battle ship as the most powerful warship afloat.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ironclads were designed for several roles, including as high seas battleships, coastal defence ships, and long-range cruisers. The rapid evolution of warship design in the late 19th century transformed the ironclad from a wooden-hulled vessel which carried sails to supplement its steam engines into the steel-built, turreted battleships and cruisers familiar in the 20th century. This change was pushed forward by the development of heavier naval guns (the ironclads of the 1880s carried some of the heaviest guns ever mounted at sea)[citation needed], more sophisticated steam engines, and advances in metallurgy which made steel shipbuilding possible.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The rapid pace of change in the ironclad period meant that many ships were obsolete as soon as they were complete, and that naval tactics were in a state of flux. Many ironclads were built to make use of the ram or the torpedo, which a number of naval designers considered the crucial weapons of naval combat. There is no clear end to the ironclad period, but towards the end of the 1890s the term ironclad dropped out of use. New ships were increasingly constructed to a standard pattern and designated battleships or armoured cruisers.
TXT_KEY_TECH_NAVAL_ARMOR_HELP Allows construction of the tough [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Ironclad[ENDCOLOR] naval unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_NAVAL_ARMOR_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"A good Navy is not a provocation to war. It is the surest guaranty of peace."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Theodore Roosevelt
TXT_KEY_TECH_BOMBARDMENT_TITLE Bombardment ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BOMBARDMENT_DESC A bombardment is an attack by artillery fire directed against fortifications, troops, or towns and buildings. Prior to World War I the term was only applied to the bombardment of defenceless or undefended objects, houses, or public buildings. It was only loosely employed to describe artillery attacks upon forts or fortified positions in preparation for assaults by infantry. Since then it has come to mean any mass attack delivered by artillery or short range tactical missiles, and also as aerial bombardment if delivered by aircraft or long range missiles.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BOMBARDMENT_HELP Allows production of the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Artillery[ENDCOLOR] seige unit, which can shoot behind obstacles.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BOMBARDMENT_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Offense is the best defense."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Unknown
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHELLS_TITLE Shells ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHELLS_DESC A shell is a payload-carrying projectile, which, as opposed to shot, contains an explosive or other filling, though modern usage sometimes includes large solid projectiles properly termed shot. All explosive and incendiary filled projectiles, particularly for mortars, were originally called grenades, derived from the pomegranate due to its seeds being similar to grains of powder. Shells are usually large calibre projectiles fired by artillery, armored fighting vehicles (including tanks), and warships.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHELLS_HELP Allows you to build the powerful [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gatlin Gun[ENDCOLOR] unit and you can now construct the [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Martyrs Square[ENDCOLOR] Wonder.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SHELLS_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Artillerymen believe the world consist of two types of people; other Artillerymen and targets."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Unknown
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRACKED_VEHICLES_TITLE Tracked Vehicles ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRACKED_VEHICLES_DESC A tank is a tracked, armoured fighting vehicle designed for front-line combat which combines operational mobility and tactical offensive and defensive capabilities. Firepower is normally provided by a large-calibre main gun in a rotating turret and secondary machine guns, while heavy armour and all-terrain mobility provide protection for the tank and its crew, allowing it to perform all primary tasks of the armoured troops on the battlefield.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRACKED_VEHICLES_HELP Allows you to build the revolutionary [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tank[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TRACKED_VEHICLES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - General William T. Sherman
TXT_KEY_TECH_TORPEDOES_TITLE Torpedoes ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_TORPEDOES_DESC The modern torpedo (historically called an automotive, automobile, locomotive or fish torpedo; colloquially called "fish") is a self-propelled explosive projectile weapon, launched above or below the water surface, propelled underwater towards a target, and designed to detonate either on contact with it or in proximity to it.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The term torpedo was originally employed for a variety of devices, most of which would today be called mines. From about 1900, "torpedo" has been used strictly to designate an underwater self-propelled missile.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]While the battleship had evolved primarily around engagements between armoured ships with large-caliber guns, the torpedo allowed torpedo boats and other lighter surface ships, submersibles, and aircraft to destroy large armoured ships without the use of large guns, though sometimes at the risk of being hit by longer-range shellfire.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Today's torpedoes can be divided into lightweight and heavyweight classes; and into straight-running, autonomous homers, and wire-guided. They can be launched from a variety of platforms.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TORPEDOES_HELP Allows you to build the cheap [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Destroyer[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_TORPEDOES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Damn the torpedoes! Full speed ahead!"[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Admiral David G. Farragut
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBMERSIBLES_TITLE Submersibles ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBMERSIBLES_DESC A submarine is a watercraft capable of independent operation below the surface of the water. The word submarine was originally an adjective meaning "under the sea"; consequently other uses such as "submarine engineering" or "submarine cable" may not actually refer at all to the vessel. Submarine was in fact shortened from the proper term, "submarine boat", and is often further shortened to "sub" when the word is employed informally. Submarines should always be referred to as "boats" rather than as "ships", regardless of their size. The English term U-boat for a German submarine comes from the German word for submarine, U-Boot, itself an abbreviation for Unterseeboot ("undersea boat").
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBMERSIBLES_HELP Allows you to build the vicious [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Submarine[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_SUBMERSIBLES_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"I must confess that my imagination refuses to see any sort of submarine doing anything but suffocating its crew and floundering at sea."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - H. G. Wells
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIG_GUNS_DOCTRINE_TITLE Big Guns Doctrine ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIG_GUNS_DOCTRINE_DESC In 1906, the British Royal Navy launched the revolutionary HMS Dreadnought. Created as a result of pressure from Admiral Sir John ("Jackie") Fisher, HMS Dreadnought made existing battleships obsolete. Combining an "all-big-gun" armament of ten 12-inch (305 mm) guns with unprecedented speed and protection, she prompted navies worldwide to re-evaluate their battleship building programmes. While the Japanese had laid down an all-big-gun battleship, Satsuma in 1904, and the concept of an all-big-gun ship had been in circulation for several years, it had yet to be validated in combat. Dreadnought sparked a new arms race, principally between Britain and Germany but reflected worldwide, as the new class of warships became a crucial element of national power.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIG_GUNS_DOCTRINE_HELP Allows you to build the powerful [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Battleship[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BIG_GUNS_DOCTRINE_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"Without a decisive naval force we can do nothing definitive, and with it, everything honorable and glorious."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - George Washington
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLITZKRIEG_TITLE Blitzkrieg ([ICON_STRENGTH])
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLITZKRIEG_DESC Blitzkrieg, translated as "lightning war," is an anglicised word describing all-motorised force concentration of tanks, infantry, artillery, combat engineers and air power, concentrating overwhelming force at high speed to break through enemy lines, and, once the lines are broken, proceeding without regard to its flank. Through constant motion, the blitzkrieg attempts to keep its enemy off-balance, making it difficult to respond effectively at any given point before the front has already moved on.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLITZKRIEG_HELP Allows you to build the mobile [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Tank[ENDCOLOR] and [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Marine[ENDCOLOR] units and the sturdy [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Infantry[ENDCOLOR] unit.
TXT_KEY_TECH_BLITZKRIEG_QUOTE [NEWLINE][TAB][TAB]"The best defense is a good offense."[NEWLINE][TAB][TAB] - Unknown
TXT_KEY_TECH_CORPORATIONS_TITLE Corporations ([ICON_GOLD])
